{{Liberalism sidebar}} '''Religious liberalism''' is a [[term (linguistics)|term]] used to describe forms of [[liberalism]] that are based on [[religious values]].
Several major [[religion]]s have found that their beliefs about [[human society]] fit with liberal principles and ideas. As a result, religious liberal movements have developed within these religions. Such movements include:
* [[Buddhist Liberalism]] * [[Liberal Christianity|Christian Liberalism]] * [[Reform Judaism|Jewish Liberalism]] * [[Liberal movements within Islam|Islamic Liberalism]]
==See also== *[[Religious communism]] *[[Religious socialism]] *[[Liberation Theology]]
